channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description:
@SenatorLorettaW We continue to not ask the question of how anti masking and other pro-covid policies entered the discourse.
@SenatorLorettaW As I asked a year and a half ago: https://t.co/QgGeRcrMGG

@AlSweigart One pain point I’m having today as I try to use the second edition’s code for automating Google Sheets and Gmail. Google seems to have revamped its authentication/token screens to make them look more like a user unfriendly enterprise product.
@cstross @Foone I do have “oops! That’s a mushroom cloud out my window!” dreams every now and then.
@Floatinginwaves @AgentFoo @HeerJeet So he’s had practice in being wrong.
@atrubek Pretty sure the answer is Squirrel Hill. Happy to connect you with a slightly younger, married Jewish woman who is very well connected there.
@AD_Lobel “What’s been on your mind, Chris? The fight on Rigel Seven?” —Dr. Boyce, “The Cage,” breaking a streak of more than four consecutive minutes in which the franchise failed to notice trauma.
@trekonomics @joshtpm I've got to agree with him. It has been hijacked by extremists -- extreme centrists!

@onthemainline @MisfitTorah The most violence I remember in high school was a little twisting by a rebbe — which ended up with the rebbe’s finger getting twisted and needing a brace for a couple weeks.

@AD_Lobel I’m about five episodes behind, but my feeling so far is a lot of resonance with the movies — both obvious things like the contemporary bus ride and the Borg Queen, and more subtle things like childhood trauma that STV approached clumsily, and highlighting a new generation crew
@AD_Lobel Like ST:TMP tried to but failed with Xon, Decker, and Ilya.
@zachsilberberg Actually, I’m glad someone remembers the short-lived Captain Marrano series.
@EvelKneidel Actually, I’m glad someone remembers the short-lived Captain Marrano series.
Woefully behind on Picard and Discovery, but prepping for Strange New Worlds by rewatching the Cage.
@atrubek As someone who grew up in a Cleveland synagogue with a Mandel name on the social hall, I feel your pain.
@JewishWonk @datadivajf How much is that in Corinthians?
@AlizaShane @EladNehorai One would hope so.
@onthemainline “Actually, Frankenstein was the name of the monster’s mohel…”
@onthemainline Might be worth thinking about duplicating your social media postings at least onto your own blog again.

@MisfitTorah @yesh222 The flip side of Republicans generally trafficking in evidence free accusations is that false accusations against them are as painful as truthful ones. The fact he was willing to play the triangulation game against them meant he had to be jettisoned.
@BenYehudaPress Counterpoint: question marks, like all punctuation, are a gentile invention and hence forbidden for Jews.

Maybe it would be fair to ask some of the Republicans amplifying Chaya R. if they agree with her religion’s teachings about the substandard souls of gentiles. https://t.co/zqpAPQAwuA
In fairness, as a Lubavitcher she has no need to hold by the Chofetz Chaim’s teachings on lashon hara.
@trekonomics Important moral: Never fact check!
Come for the definitive thread on social media moderation. Stick around for a smart hack for carbon sequestration. https://t.co/BhC5EqRCg0
@_breeeeen_ @ProtonSupport @mg “Emails sent from https://t.co/RAiVWlGX5v, https://t.co/e3lRhIQBKV, and custom domains were not affected by this issue”
@drewjakeprof It feels like all his purely informational interviews -- he had one the other day about Ukraine I think -- are simply a cover for these assassination jobs.

Hey, folk song army! This hero of NJ-NY relations should have been memorialized by The Kingston Trio back in the day (not enough political content to warrant the Weavers) but they failed to act. Can we pull together something now? https://t.co/BGi1Il4ZIi
